intro: Achyronia forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' puccoon, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish to reddish flowers that bloom in the summer. Its roots are used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported medicinal properties. Achyronia forbesii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in prairies and woodland edges.
